definition: lit. like a sheet of loose sand/fig. unable to cooperate (idiom)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
variant of 散[san4]
granule/hoarse/raspy/sand/powder/CL:粒[li4]/abbr. for Tsar or Tsarist Russia
surname Sha

sentences.english: The entity lacking self-discipline is only in a state of disunity .
sentences.chinese: 缺乏自律的整体永远都只是一盘散沙。

sentences.english: Democracy is fine , but coalition politics will always hold us back.
sentences.chinese: 民煮固然好，但是一盘散沙的政策会永远阻碍我们。

sentences.english: But Greater Syria is more of a hodgepodge.
sentences.chinese: 与之相比，大叙利亚更像是一盘散沙。

definition: scattered sand/fig. lacking in cohesion or organization
(of a nation, government etc) demoralized/disunited
lit. a thunder of dragons without a head/fig. a group lacking a leader
lit. straggling and disbanded soldiers (idiom); fig. disorganized uncoordinated action
to do things each in one's own way
to collapse on the first encounter/to give way at once
It's hard to clap with only one hand./It takes two to tango/It's difficult to achieve anything without support.
mob
backbone/mainstay/pillar/definite view/one's own judgment
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
utterly defeated/routed/crushed/to collapse (of army)
utterly defeated
to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
to twist together to form a rope/(fig.) to unite/to work together
